008 *******************************************************************************/
009package imagingbook.common.util;
010
011import java.io.ByteArrayOutputStream;
012import java.io.PrintStream;
013
014/**
015 * <p>
016 * Classes which require a complex {@code toString()} method should implement
017 * this interface, which requires the single method
018 * {@link #printToStream(PrintStream)}, e.g.,
019 * </p>
020 * 
021 * <pre>
022 * public void printToStream(PrintStream strm) {
023 *     strm.format("...", ...);
024 * }
025 * </pre>
026 * <p>
027 * Note that this interface cannot override the default
028 * {@link Object#toString()} method directly. If needed, this should be done in
029 * the implementing class by using the pre-defined {@link #printToString()}
030 * method:
031 * </p>
032 * 
033 * <pre>
034 * public String toString() {
035 *      return printToString();
036 * }
037 * </pre>
038 * 
039 * @author WB
040 * @version 2021/09/17
041 */
042public interface PrintsToStream {
043        
044        /**
045         * This method writes a description of this object to the specified
046         * {@link PrintStream}.
047         * 
048         * @param strm the output stream to print to
049         */
050        public void printToStream(PrintStream strm);
051        
052        /**
053         * Convenience method to save some boilerplate code. Calls
054         * {@link #printToStream(PrintStream)} to produce a description string for this
055         * object. The {@link #printToString()} method can also be used by implementing
056         * classes to override the standard {@link Object#toString()} method, e.g.,
057         * <pre>
058         * &#64;Override
059         * public String toString() {
060         *      return this.printToString();
061         * }
062         * </pre>
063         * 
064         * @return the string representation of this object as defined by {@link #printToStream(PrintStream)}
065         */
066        public default String printToString() {
067                ByteArrayOutputStream bas = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
068                try (PrintStream strm = new PrintStream(bas)) {
069                        this.printToStream(strm);
070                }
071                return bas.toString();
072        }
073
074}
